channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Optical illusion leaves puzzlers divided - but do YOU know what is happening in the picture?
item.description: A bizarre optical illusion has left thousands of Reddit users questioning whether the image really is a static one, or if it is actually a moving GIF. One user commented 'I don't feel so good',

item.title: Footballer Marcus Rashford makes the front cover of Vogue in Black Lives Matter-themed edition
item.description: Marcus Rashford, 22, shared a photo of the British Vogue cover on Twitter and said he was 'humbled' to be recognised for his free school meals campaign.

item.title: 'Fury' in Melbourne over spike that ruined Australia's COVID-19 recovery: and it's set to get worse
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison said he understands the anger and fury of Victorians facing tough coronavirus lockdown measures, as a frontline nurse warns the situation will get worse.

item.title: Joe Biden delays his vice presidential pick by TWO WEEKS
item.description: Joe Biden has delayed naming his vice presidential pick by two weeks amid worries the process become mess as Kamala Harris, Karen Bass and Susan Rice emerge as favorites.

item.title: WWII veteran Captain Sir Tom Moore, 100, is 'delighted' by 'truly great honour'
item.description: Captain Sir Tom Moore said he was 'absolutely thrilled' to be made honorary colonel of the Army Foundation College in Harrogate during a visit to the North Yorkshire facility today.
item.media:description: Captain Sir Tom Moore during a visit to the Army Foundation College in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, as part of his new role as honorary colonel of the military training establishment (Danny Lawson/PA)

item.title: Farm worker found alive five years after being presumed dead
item.description: Ricardas Puisys, 40, who is from Lithuania, was discovered by police in a 'very well concealed' location in woods nearby a cluster of houses in Wisbech, Cambridgeshire.

item.title: Inside Mike and Carole Middleton's Buckleberry mansion
item.description: James Middleton, 33, has been sharing glimpses into his parents Bucklebury mansion during the coronavirus pandemic, including shots of the chic kitchen and plush outdoor dining area.

item.title: Spain's former king Juan Carlos, 82, announces he is LEAVING the country amid corruption scandal
item.description: Spain's former king Juan Carlos has told his son, King Felipe, that he decided to leave Spain, the royal house said in a statement on Monday.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's dog's name revealed
item.description: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry named their black Labrador 'Pula', according to People Magazine. The name is believed to have been inspired by the couple's first trip together to Africa.

item.title: Pharmacy refuses to serve mother recovering from surgery to reattach her nose
item.description: Shereen Mawson, a 36-year-old mother, said an employee at her local Catts Pharmacy Snodland, Kent, which is run by Paydens, shouted at her for not wearing a face mask.

item.title: Singapore is making foreign visitors wear electronic tags to ensure they follow quarantine rules
item.description: The city-state is gradually reopening its borders and from August 11 devices will be given to travellers, including citizens and residents, from a select group of countries.

item.title: Former SDLP leader and Nobel peace prize winner John Hume dies at 83
item.description: President Clinton, a mediator in the peace process, this afternoon praised Hume's 'unshakeable commitment to nonviolence, persistence, kindness and love'.

item.title: Staff call Ellen DeGeneres 'Talk Show Karen' as insiders says James Corden will NOT be replacing her
item.description: Sources tell DailyMail.com Sean Hayes, Kristen Bell, Melissa McCarthy and the ultimate A-lister Jennifer Aniston are in the running to take over Ellen DeGeneres' spot.

item.title: Police bodycam footage shows George Floyd arrest in detail
item.description: WARNING: DISTURBING CONTENT. DailyMail.com has obtained video from the body cameras of two officers involved in the arrest of George Floyd that ultimately led to his death on May 25 in Minneapolis.

item.title: Female rapper dies after butt surgery carried out by doctor who was not a qualified cosmetic surgeon
item.description: Fernanda Rodrigues, 43, also known as Mc Atrevida, underwent the butt augmentation surgery at a clandestine aesthetic clinic in Rio de Janeiro which was carried out by a gynaecologist.

item.title: Top scientist slams 'shroud of secrecy' around 'shambolic' coronavirus decisions
item.description: Sir Paul Nurse, chief of the Francis Crick Institute, raised concerns that crucial choices seemed to be made by a 'black box' in Whitehall with the results sometimes 'shambolic'.

item.title: Royal Navy counter-piracy warship HMS Trent sailing to Med
item.description: The 295ft ship HMS Trent is designed for duties including counter piracy and counter-terrorism. But friends and family of crew members had to watch proceedings at Portsmouth Naval Base live online.

item.title: Lost and injured staycation holidaymakers hiking in Lake District put rescue teams at breaking point
item.description: Rescue chiefs are warning that adventurous Britons flocking to the Lake District in search of some post-lockdown freedom are putting their teams under pressure.
item.media:credit: Lake District Search and Mountain Rescue Association

item.title: Trade documents 'stolen from Liam Fox by Russian hackers'
item.description: The documents were brandished by the hard Left MP at a press conference in November days before he led his party to a catastrophic vote defeat at the hands of Boris Johnson.

item.title: Principality of Hutt River dissolves after 50 years of 'independence' from Australia
item.description: The Principality of Hutt River, a tiny slab of Australian outback that declared independence 50 years ago, will finally rejoin the the rest of the nation after coronavirus killed its tourist income.

item.title: Former Pope Benedict, 93, is 'seriously ill with shingles'
item.description: Emeritus Pope Benedict, 93, became very frail following a trip to Bavaria in June to see his dying brother and is his voice is now barely audible, according to biographer Peter Seewald.

item.title: UK records just five Covid-19 deaths in preliminary toll
item.description: The Department of Health said 938 Britons tested positive for Covid-19 in the last 24 hours, up by nearly 40 per cent compared to last Monday (678).

item.title: Man, 36, admits manslaughter after stabbing 'gifted' geography student, 21, to death
item.description: Paul Crowther denied murder but pleaded guilty to charge of manslaughter of 21-year-old environmental geography student Bethany Fields last September in Huddersfield town centre.

item.title: 'Mystery' 15ft sea creature that washed up in Liverpool is a dolphin or a porpoise
item.description: Dubbed the Ainsdale Anomaly, the stinking remains were spotted on a Merseyside beach last Wednesday and have sparked debate as far away as New Zealand.

item.title: Dogs process speech in the same way as human brains do, study finds
item.description: Both dogs and human brains separately process the intonation - how a voice rises and falls - and the meaning of the words spoken.

item.title: Aristocrat and interior designer locked in court battle over refurbishment of Notting Hill mansion
item.description: Lord James Russell claims designer Lucinda Sanford let project run more than a year past the completion date and more than £1m over budget. The designer blames issues on family's indecision

item.title: Balearic and Canary islands STAY on UK quarantine list despite Spanish insisting they are safe
item.description: Arrivals from islands including Ibiza, Majorca, Tenerife and Gran Canaria have been under quarantine rules since last week, when they joined the Spanish mainland on the UK's red travel list.

item.title: Microsoft will release its ultra lifelike Flight Simulator this month on PC
item.description: The software will make use of satellite maps as well as live readings from weather stations and airports around the world to create 'the most realistic' version of the game ever developed.

item.title: London Underground trains are far from busy as workers ignore government's drive to get to office
item.description: There were 240,000 trips made on the London Underground during rush hour to 10am, which marks a six per cent rise on last week.

item.title: WHO spokesperson interrupted by bizarre noise of dog barking on Sky news
item.description: WHO spokesperson Dr Margaret Harris, from the UK, was interrupted by the bizarre noise of her dog barking during a live section on Sky news today.

item.title: Cuban business owner decries BLM's 'mafia tactics' after letter
item.description: The letter went out to business owners in East Market District in Louisville, also known as NuLu, during a protest on July 24 that forced some of the businesses in the area to close.

item.title: Metal detectorist unearths hoard of silver civil war era coins worth £100,000 in field outside pub
item.description: Luke Mahoney, 40, unearthed 1,078 silver, hammered coins dating back to somewhere around the 15th-17th century in Lindsey, Suffolk.

item.title: Minneapolis police struggle to cope with a surge in violent crime after the death of George Floyd
item.description: Minneapolis police are down 10% of the force since the death of George Floyd amid a surge in violent crime. Police have advised residents 'be prepared to give up your cellphone' to stay safe.

item.title: Matt Hancock DENIES plans for over-50s lockdown after outcry
item.description: Under one option, people aged between 50 and 70 would get personalised risk ratings as part of a significant widening of the shielding programme.

item.title: Pictured: Hero father who died after saving three of his children
item.description: Jonathan 'Joff' Stevens, 36, of Telford, Shropshire, was with the youngsters aged ten to 12 at Barmouth in North Wales when they began to struggle in the water yesterday lunchtime.

item.title: UK passenger jailed for sexual assault of easyJet stewardess
item.description: Kramat Khan touched the flight attendant inappropriately without consent and then later grabbed her from behind in a tight hug and kissed her neck, ignoring her pleas for him to stop.

item.title: Breathtaking images compete in prestigious International Photography Awards
item.description: From frozen lakes to flame orange canyons and aerial pictures of remote football pitches, a stunning array of images showcases the work of some of the world's finest photographers.

item.title: Remains of a 10ft tall Woolly mammoth discovered in a Siberian lake 10,000 years after it died
item.description: Experts from the Scientific Centre for Arctic studies have been working on studying the 10,000 year old remains of the giant mammal that was found in silt deposits.

item.title: Sadiq Khan furious at 'plans to quarantine London inside M25'
item.description: Mayor of London Sadiq Khan has written to the PM to voice 'great surprise' at suggestions the capital could be effectively sealed off if there is a spike in coronavirus infections.

item.title: Granada Reports presenter Tony Morris dies aged 57
item.description: Morris had presented ITV's regional news programme in the North West, for 17 years. Co-presenter Lucy Meacock said: he was 'one of the most humble, kind and funny people I have ever met'.

item.title: Coleen Rooney wears plunging red swimsuit in Barbados
item.description: The mother of four, 34, slipped her curves into the halter-neck one piece, which she teamed with a pair of oversized round sunglasses and a pair of silver hoop earrings.

item.title: Painkillers 'should not be prescribed for chronic pain'
item.description: There is 'little or no evidence' the commonly used drugs work, according to England's health regulators, the National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (Nice).

item.title: Gordon Ramsay BLASTS American woman for MICROWAVED fish and chips
item.description: Michelle who is originally from North Carolina but currently living in the UK, shared her method for make traditional fish and chips, using root beer, egg yolk and sugar, with her 205,000 TikTok followers.

item.title: Domestic abuse victim says torment far worse during lockdown
item.description: Speaking anonymously to BBC News , the woman, who lives somewhere in the UK, said the torment reached the point where she no longer cared if she woke up in the morning.

item.title: Scientist angers Twitter after saying roundworms are useless
item.description: A row has erupted on Twitter after editor of science journal eLife said the roundworm was the 'most overhyped' animal. Fellow scientists accused him of 'microaggresion', sexism and racism.

item.title: Rare Lamborghini Miura SV supercar sells for £1.9MILLION
item.description: The Miura SV was one of the most desirable cars on the planet when it was made in 1972. Only 147 left the marque's factory in Italy, of which only nine were right-hand drive.

item.title: Man and woman are found dead inside car at country park in Dorset as police launch investigation
item.description: The casualties were discovered in an unresponsive state in a car by passers-by at Durlston Country Park, near Swanage in Dorset. They were pronounced dead at the scene.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Scientist says case rises NOT second wave
item.description: Professor Tim Spector, an epidemiologist at King's College London, shot down Boris Johnson and Health Secretary Matt Hancock's claims that a 'second wave' of Covid-19' was developing.

item.title: One in ten Britons are breaking face-mask rules on trains and buses - but just 285 passengers fined
item.description: The Cabinet minister wrote that the compliance rate is 90 per cent, after face coverings on public transport became mandatory in England on June 15 in a bid to slow the spread of the virus.
item.media:description: One in 10 public transport users in Britain are breaking rules on mandatory face coverings, Transport Secretary Grant Shapps said (Victoria Jones/PA)

item.title: Fears of a stampede to the UK's beauty spots as ten-day 'African heat flare' on the way
item.description: Tourists on staycations are expected to flock back to beaches across the UK as temperatures up to 91F (33C) sweep in from central Europe by the end of the week - following 71F (22C) today.

item.title: Do Matt Hancock's new coronavirus tests even work? Scientists urge government to release data
item.description: Scientists have called on No 10 to release data from independent evaluations to confirm both tests work. The tests from DNANudge and Oxford Nanopore will be rolled out from next week.

item.title: Burglary gang who targeted Raheem Sterling and Jay Kay jailed
item.description: The gang from Liverpool targeted high-profile businessmen and women, footballers and celebrities, including the home of Manchester City and England football star Raheem Sterling.

item.title: Trio of squirrels make their home in a London chimney stack
item.description: The group of squirrels were seen playing and chasing each other's tails in their new chimney stack home in Willesden Green, London.

item.title: Google finally unveils £349 Pixel 4a 'iPhone rival' smartphone
item.description: It is only available in black at the minute and will be available for pre-order in UK, Ireland, France, Germany, Italy, Spain on September 10 and will go on sale on October 1.

item.title: Japanese beetle survives being eaten by frog 94.4% of time
item.description: Incredible footage shows a small aquatic beetle being squeezed from the rear end of the black-spotted frog nearly two hours after being eaten in lab experiments.

item.title: Some Mars valleys may have formed under ancient ICE sheets
item.description: Researchers from the US used a special computer algorithm to study thousands of valleys on the red planet - and reveal the processes that formed them.

item.title: BA scraps London to New York all-business-class service
item.description: The JFK service was launched in 2009 and was operated using bespoke Airbus A318s that had just 32 seats - all of which could be converted into 6ft fully flat beds.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Manchester cases DOUBLED last week
item.description: The London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine estimate the 'R' level has risen well above the danger zone in the North West. An R above 1 risks allowing the virus to grow exponentially.

item.title: BT give Shropshire pensioner £100k quote for better broadband
item.description: John Simister (pictured), 72, from near Ellesmere in Shropshire, called the telecommunications giant after years of woeful internet.

item.title: Climbers take their son, three, and daughter, seven, up 11,000ft Alp
item.description: Freya Houlding, seven, climbed Piz Badile - on the border of Switzerland and Italy - along with her mother Jessica, 41, and professional climber father Leo Houlding, 40, in just three days.

item.title: Police hunt killer who raped and strangled British backpacker in Thailand in 2000 with week left
item.description: Kirsty Jones, 23, from Tredomen, Powys was three months into a two-year world trip when she was found dead in a room at the Aree guest house in Chiang Mai and her killer has never been found.

item.title: Giant whale and calf splash around with Australian surfers
item.description: Surfers were surprised when a mother whale and her calf frolicked in the water within feet of them in Manly, Australia. The two whales splash in the water and even knock some surfers off their boards.

item.title: Coronavirus: WHO says 0.6% of all patients die from infection
item.description: Speaking at the WHO's headquarters in Geneva, officials said Covid-19 appears to kill 0.6% of all patients, or one in every 200, making it six times deadlier than the flu.

item.title: Niall Horan and new girlfriend Amelia Woolley enjoy date
item.description: Niall and girlfriend of three months Amelia were seen getting cosy as they strolled home from a boozy dinner with friends at Fiume Battersea on Saturday.

item.title: Former teacher, 67, dies 'shortly after being charged with historical sexual offence'
item.description: Tim Harbord, 67, worked at Colet Court for 25 years. One former student was told by a police officer that he was charged with indecent assault but then killed himself shortly after.

item.title: Woman blows Facebook mind after revealing how she bought an inflatable bathtub for her wet room
item.description: Sharon Guichard, from Greenwich, revealed she bought the inflatable tub on Amazon for her wet room. She shared her find on the Extreme Couponing and Bargains UK Facebook group.

item.title: Hays Travel is to axe 878 jobs after Spain quarantine 'triggered holiday cancellations'
item.description: The travel company said it has 'made every possible effort' to avoid job losses 'during these extraordinary and distressing times'.

item.title: 'I'm not religious, but I prayed for this one': Emotional Elon Musk welcomes home NASA astronauts
item.description: The billionaire SpaceX CEO, main, rushed to Houston from the company's headquarters in Hawthorne, California to welcome astronauts Doug Hurley and Bob Behnken home on Sunday, inset.

item.title: Police officer is charged with assault after car thief 'was kicked and punched during arrest'
item.description: PC Saul Hignett, 26, has been charged with Section 39 assault after footage showed car thief Adeel Ashraf, 34, being attacked during his arrest in Accrington, Lancashire, on January 8.

item.title: Coronavirus Germany: Social-distancing protests in Berlin
item.description: Thousands of people - many with no masks - took to the streets to protest Germany 's coronavirus restrictions on Saturday in a demonstration that insisted 'the end of the pandemic' has arrived.

item.title: Chief whip Mark Spencer faces questions over Tory MP sex assault claim
item.description: Sources insisted that when Mark Spencer (pictured) spoke to the woman in April he was not told of any accusation of serious sexual abuse by the unnamed former minister.

item.title: Socialites make the most of the summer by picking quiet destinations for their lavish holidays
item.description: Socialites are enjoying a relaxing summer 2020 and have picked quiet destinations, away from the crowds. Some headed to the beaches of Spain and France, will others went to Colombia.

item.title: Tesco worker finds 'world's most venomous' spider in bananas
item.description: Jack Farrar, from Portsmouth, discovered the spider while he unpacked a box of bananas shipped from Colombia at a Tesco Extra store in Havant, Hampshire on Wednesday.

item.title: Kate Middleton and Prince William release unseen photo of Prince Louis to thank royal fans
item.description: Prince Louis, who turned two in April, bears a strong resemblance to his older brother Prince George, now seven, as well as his father Prince William as a young boy, in the photo taken in Norfolk.

item.title: 'Major incident' in locked down Manchester as coronavirus cases keep going UP
item.description: With Greater Manchester accounting for seven of the 20 worse hit areas of England, officials banned members of different households from mingling at home or in pubs and restaurants.

item.title: Fly-tippers forced to load rubbish BACK ONTO their lorry
item.description: James Johnston, from Glasgow, spotted the two men dumping planks of wood and other debris in his field and insisted that they remove it straight away. The men reloaded the debris into a van.

item.title: Two traffic wardens slap £50 tickets on supercars worth £400,000 while they park on
item.description: The pair left their Toyota Yaris on the roadside before placing fixed penalty notices on an £80,000 Tesla, a Porsche worth £110,000 and a Rolls Royce worth around £200,000 near Altrincham.

item.title: Government's half-price restaurant scheme Eat Out To Help Out finally launches
item.description: Restaurants, pubs and cafes across Britain are offering half-price meals to diners during August in an attempt to boost the hospitality sector following the Covid-19 lockdown.

item.title: Food lovers share their Eat Out to Help Out deals on first day
item.description: Diners shared photographs of meals at the likes of McDonald's, Subway, Costa and Pret a Manger as they enjoyed a 50 per cent discount on food and soft drinks.

item.title: Footballers will be shown a red card if they cough deliberately at another person amid coronavirus
item.description: The rules dictate that in the situation where a 'clear act' of coughing towards someone occurs, the player in question should be disciplined with a red card, removing them from the game.

item.title: David and Victoria Beckham's Cotwolds building plans slammed
item.description: In an email sent to West Oxfordshire District Council, the frustrated local Mr Michael Douglas accused the famous couple of 'trying to bring suburbia to the countryside'.

item.title: Thousands of BA workers facing axe must choose today between redundancy or 'up to 50% pay cut'
item.description: British Airways staff facing the axe must decide today whether to take redundancy or face the possibility of lower wages and poorer terms and conditions.

item.title: Heathrow chaos gets WORSE as crowds are again forced into massive queues with no social-distancing
item.description: Rows of passengers were last night seen queuing around the barriers of an escalator - in close proximity to each other - as they approached passport control at Heathrow's Terminal 5.

item.title: First World War diaries which recount first days of the Battle of the Somme go up for auction
item.description: Gunner H Belshaw and Captain John Oliver Mark Ashley wrote their journals from the Western Front between April 1, 1916 right until the end of the conflict on November 11, 1918.

item.title: 'Magaluf' revellers drinking, camping illegally and dumping litter in the Lake District
item.description: Residents in the Lake District say groups of young people sit around drinking and smash up fences for fire wood and are making parts of the beauty spot 'like Blackpool seafront'.

item.title: Violent crime climbs back to pre coronavirus lockdown levels
item.description: London Mayor Sadiq Khan said there is a 'real risk of violent crime spiking as lockdown is eased' in the capital after the pandemic sent crime rates plummeting by a quarter in England and Wales.

item.title: Scientists say public transport may not be a major source of coronavirus spread
item.description: New data from contact tracing studies in Japan, France and Austria suggest that, if masks are worn and social distancing is adhered to, the chance of the virus spreading on public transport is minimal.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Super-fast tests 'could keep schools open'
item.description: Nadhim Zahawi said the new 90-minute tests - to be introduced next week - would available to be rolled-out into settings like classrooms in September to help reduce disruption.

item.title: Vigilante mob confronts dog owner in beach car park
item.description: A crowd began gathering around a people carrier parked at Norman's Bay in East Sussex after spotting the animal barking in the boot.

item.title: Putting North West under new lockdown measures was a 'rash' decision, top expert claims
item.description: Professor Carl Heneghan, director of Oxford University's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine, claimed cases aren't rising and that higher rates have been skewed by inaccurate data.

item.title: Thieves steal artificial grass from grandmother's front garden in the middle of the night
item.description: Elizabeth Glover, 62, said she was in shock when she woke up on Sunday to discover the patch of green missing from the front garden of her home in St Helens.

item.title: Five injured after shotgun was fired at illegal street party in Birmingham
item.description: Armed police were sent to Dudley Road in Winson Green at 1.45am this morning as they responded to calls of a firearm being discharged in the street.

item.title: Kate Middleton is 'devastated' while Prince Harry and Prince William's conversations are 'stilted'
item.description: Royal authors Andrew Morton and Phil Damper told New Idea Prince William, 38, has had 'difficult' conversations with the Duke of Sussex, 35, amid the publishing of Finding Freedom.

item.title: Hands off Gibraltar: Britain blasts Spain over secret American lobbying campaign
item.description: Several current and former members of Congress said they were approached by the Spanish embassy in Washington after backing the British Overseas Territory's sovereignty.

item.title: Dog rushed to vets with suspected coronavirus after eating ill owner's used tissues
item.description: Terrified Mandy Hayes, from Kent, feared her dog Mushka had contracted coronavirus after he developed symptoms including dry 'covid' cough and extreme breathlessness

item.title: WWII hero's medal haul and damaged helmet sells for £18,600
item.description: The damaged helmet of Group Captain Arthur Donaldson who survived being struck by flak while travelling at 300mph have sold along with his bravery medals for £18,600.

item.title: Your chance to live like a Bond villain as three remote island forts go on sale
item.description: The three 19th century forts, Spitbank, No Man's and Horse Sand, which sit between Portsmouth and the Isle of Wight, have already gathered interest from international investors.

item.title: Audi R8 explodes in flames on M6 after armed police chase
item.description: Police have released new footage showing the moment a stolen Audi R8 exploded into flames on an exit slip road after it was pursued by West Midlands Police along the M6 near Birmingham.

item.title: Coronavirus cruise outbreak in Norway as 40 people fall sick
item.description: Thirty six crew and four passengers who rode on Norwegian cruise liner MS Roald Amundsen last month have tested positive for coronavirus, as officials race to trace 387 more who could be infected.

item.title: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry donate £8,000 to cookery charity
item.description: Migrateful, a London-based charity, announced on Twitter that they were 'so excited' to have received a donation of £8,000 from The Royal Foundation on behalf of Meghan Markle, 38.

item.title: Mother, 51, 'dug 35ft tunnel by hand in attempt to break son out of jail' in Ukraine
item.description: The 51-year-old, who has not been named, shifted three tons of earth over three weeks using hand tools in an attempt to free her son from jail in Ukraine, where he is serving life for murder.

item.title: Cat jailed after being found with heroin around his neck ESCAPES from prison in Colomno
item.description: The feline was detected by Colombo jail intelligence officials on Saturday at the high-security Welikada Prison, a police official said, adding that the feline was found carrying two grams of heroin.

item.title: British expat dies after plunging down an uncovered manhole in Spain
item.description: Richie Kennedy, 39, originally from Brighton, was trapped for 15 hours after tumbling down the manhole in Calahonda, Mijas Costa, where he died of his head injuries.

item.title: Macey the hero bulldog chases off four machete-wielding burglars
item.description: When father-of-four Paul Davis's house in Birmingham was attacked by hooded thugs, his devoted Staffordshire bull terrier Macey didn't think twice about 'laying her life on the line' for her family.

item.title: Black Premier League star Danny Rose is regularly stopped by police and asked if his car is stolen
item.description: The Tottenham and Newcastle star also lifted the lid on how he is even stopped from entering the first class carriage on trains and questioned over whether he has the correct ticket.

item.title: Iran has LIED about its Covid-19 deaths: 42,000 people have died - not 14,000
item.description: The stark numbers come from an anonymous source who leaked official documents to the BBC. It shows that the first Covid-19 death jn Iran was on January 22.

item.title: TV presenter, 28, viciously beaten by a stranger who tried to rape her in front of six-year-old son
item.description: Anastasia Lugova, 28, was assaulted by Vitaliy Rudzko, 45, during a train journey from Mariupol to Kyiv, on Friday. She was sleeping with her son, six, when Rudzko broke in wearing only underwear.

item.title: British woman dodges death penalty for stabbing husband to death in Malaysia
item.description: Samantha Jones, 51, from Somerset, broke down in tears in court in Malaysia as a judge ruled that she will not face the death penalty for stabbing husband John, 63, to death in 2018.

item.title: BBC receive 'more than 100' complaints after airing CBBC's first same sex kiss
item.description: The BBC children's network was lauded by viewers and LGBT rights charity Stonewall for showing the channel's first ever same sex kiss.

item.title: Alternative therapist, 62, sues indoor ski slope for £200,000
item.description: Former City worker Theresa Bates, 62, of Hornchurch, Essex, was hurt when she fell while taking a lesson at the 150ft-high Snozone centre in Milton Keynes.

item.title: Woman, 21, reveals how she first thought rare slow-growing tumour was a hangover
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Amber Scott, 21, from Northern Ireland, had spent two years prior to her diagnosis in 2019, telling doctors about her severe stomach pains - but was constantly misdiagnosed with IBS.

item.title: Texas dog groomer bursts into tears as she is gifted a new puppy
item.description: Vikki Sapp, 51, was surprised with a puppy by her coworker at a dog salon in Waco, Texas, Heather Hodges, 26, got the new puppy after Ms Sapp's last dog Diego died.

item.title: Greek restaurant goes viral with sassy response to influencers 'begging' for a free meal
item.description: An anonymous British Reddit user, 39, went viral on the discussion forum this week, after revealing his family's vegetarian restaurant in Greece regularly get freebie requests from influencers.

item.title: Brian McFadden and fiancée Danielle Parkinson reveal they suffered a 'devastating' miscarriage
item.description: The former Westlife singer, 40, and the PE teacher, 38, opened up about their fertility struggles, explaining they tried to conceived naturally for two years, before turning to doctors for help.

item.title: Manufacturing bounces back in July as Boris urges UK back to work but experts warn of long recovery
item.description: Furloughed staff returned to work and customers started spending, according to a closely watched survey released today.

item.title: How I built my dream home: Wiltshire's £1.9M Long Barn
item.description: The Long Barn is a 200-year old barn that was painstakingly converted over four years from derelict buildings.and is now on the market, we got a tour from the owner.

item.title: Green-fingered thief in Birmingham steals three PLANT POTS from outside family home
item.description: A man wearing a tracksuit pulled up to a house in Harbourne, Birmingham, and stole three plant pots from a front garden. West Midlands Police said the Ford Focus had false number plates.

item.title: 'Anti-ageing' enzyme 'tweaked' by scientists made roundworms live longer
item.description: Researchers from KAIST (Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology), were able to dial up and down creatures' lifespans by altering protein activity levels.

item.title: Kate Garraway wanted to donate her blood plasma to husband Derek Draper
item.description: Kate Garraway has revealed she offered to donate her blood plasma to husband Derek Draper after they were both struck down with coronavirus.

item.title: Women reveal the outrageously sexist encounters they've experienced
item.description: A woman who was refused service from a British company because her husband wasn't at the appointment vented her frustrations on Mumsnet. Many contributed their own experience of sexism.

item.title: HSBC's profits plunge by 65% due to coronavirus
item.description: The bank (pictured, its London HQ) reported profits of 4.3 billion US dollars (£3.2 billion) in the half year to June 30, down from 12.4 billion dollars (£9.5 billion) in the same period in 2019.

item.title: PC Andrew Harper's killer brags 'I'm a real man' as he is arrested outside pub in two year old video
item.description: Footage of the incident, posted on social media in April 2017, shows Long being taken to a police car by police officers, who he taunts as they attempt to bundle him in.

item.title: Kurt Maflin warned for giving the cue ball the MIDDLE FINGER in Snooker World Championship match
item.description: World Snooker confirmed that Maflin would not face any further punishment beyond the referee's warning, while Eurosport commentator Dominic Dale apologised to viewers for any offence.

item.title: Famous faces are brought to life in newly colourised photos
item.description: Classics student Mads Madsen, 25, who lives in Denmark, told Bored Panda he's colourised hundreds of images by hand using oil paint since discovering the technique online.

item.title: Vive la France! M&S launches range of 25 dishes by Parisian gourmet frozen food brand Picard
item.description: Picard, which has more than 700 stores in France and specialises in gourmet frozen food items including decadent canapés, showstopping desserts and breakfast treats, has arrived at M&S.

item.title: People share the hilarious texts that prove sometimes a phone call is better
item.description: Amusing text messages posted to the Instagram account Funny Texts reveal the comebacks sent by people from around the world can often be as hilarious as the smartphone mishaps.

item.title: Mum's robot carpet cleaner tangled in toilet paper is crowned this year's most relatable post
item.description: Australians say photos of the entanglement perfectly encapsulate the mood of the nation five months into the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Mother reveals clever trick for getting sand off your hands and feet after a day at the beach
item.description: Mother Stephanie Scheff, from California, posted the video on TikTok, where it had thousands of comments and was viewed more than 250,000 times.

item.title: Inquiry finds racial bias, bullying in Iowa football...
item.description: An external review of the University of Iowa's football team revealed a trend of racial bias and bullying endure by Black players on the team. 111 players and staff were interviewed.
